messages.subject: unused space
messages.msgSnippet: The space between. We try to use that concept when decorating or creating spaces for things in our home. It s a very conscious part of art in Japan. We call
messages.messageBody:
"The space between. We try to use that concept when decorating or creating
spaces for things in our home. It's a very conscious part of art in Japan."

We call them "spaces that breathe" here.....although there aren't any in our
tiny house, except in my dh's space!!
There are artists that use loads of empty space on a canvas or paper to make
a point...
I think it is imperative for adults to allow children to create unhindered
and non-coerced in order for unique individualism to emerge.
When a person needs a specific skill in art, then showing them the way to
acheive that is useful. But making a person use up a whole piece of paper is
detrimental to the natural flowering of that child's creative voice.

Ren, another artist that likes to be left alone
